name: Haravgi
description:
How To Play:

- Move with WASD

- Run with shift

- Open quest journal with J

- Interact with objects and characters with spacebar and left click, according to the prompts

Haravgi (pronunciation) is a story-based adventure game set in a town of the same name. It makes use of intertwining stories with multiple paths. There is a festival happening in town, and your Uncle has just gotten back home from it. But, he has forgotten to bring his hat home with him! Explore Haravgi and uncover the lives of the various residents as you make your way around the festival. They might not be as happy as they initially seem, but there is always a silver lining in every cloud.

Made in Unity with the Pixel Crushers Dialogue System, Haravgi demonstrates the capabilities of the system to script sequences and create interesting video game experiences. By using filmmaking techniques such as mise en scene and dynamic camera angles, Haravgi frames each conversation and character uniquely. The seemingly demonic Hyro is shrouded in darkness, while the extroverted Aya stays near the bonfire. The conversations that the player has with the characters develops their psychological and social dimensions, creating a fun story. The level design leads the player towards their goals with props, lighting, and fields of view.

Design by Joseph Poselenzny. VIEW PORTFOLIO
